intro: Antheroporum vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Antheroporum vidalii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
